title: Integrate with major gig economy platform APIs for earnings retrieval
summary: Build API integrations to retrieve verified income and transaction data from leading gig economy platforms. This enables the system to access earnings details across a broad set of providers, forming the data foundation for loan origination and risk assessment.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: aggregating income data across multiple platforms (Uber, DoorDash, Upwork, Fiverr, etc.) via API integrations

title: Aggregate and normalize income data from multiple sources
summary: Develop data processing logic to combine, standardize, and reconcile varying income records from several gig platforms. This ensures a consistent, unified dataset for downstream eligibility and compliance evaluation.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: normalize and verify earnings ... aggregating their income data across multiple platforms

title: Design dynamic eligibility rules for assessing gig income
summary: Specify and implement adaptable rules for evaluating applicant eligibility based on variable gig income sources. The rules should capture income volatility and apply fair, risk-based criteria to ensure accuracy in lending decisions.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: apply dynamic eligibility rules ... accounting for gig income volatility

title: Implement admin controls for adjusting eligibility logic
summary: Create administrative interfaces and controls allowing designated staff to update, fine-tune, and approve eligibility criteria in real time. Ensures rapid adaptation to policy changes and risk strategies.

title: Handle eligibility edge cases: zero earnings, unsupported currencies
summary: Develop processes and checks for scenarios where applicants have zero recorded earnings or submit income in unsupported currencies. Provides robust edge case coverage to maintain system dependability and regulatory compliance.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: handle edge cases like missing data or unsupported currencies

title: Require KYC and AML checks for all applicants
summary: Integrate Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) verifications for every applicant. This is fundamental for financial compliance, customer due diligence, and fraud risk mitigation.

title: Implement fraud detection for anomalous or inflated reported income
summary: Deploy advanced fraud detection mechanisms targeting abnormal or exaggerated income submissions. The system should flag suspicious patterns to protect lending integrity and minimize risk.

title: Design user consent workflows and feedback for API data connection
summary: Create intuitive workflows for users to grant API access for earnings data, encompassing clear consent prompts and real-time feedback on connection status. Prioritizes transparency and user empowerment.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: clear consent, status feedback ... provide additional documentation

title: Display earnings summaries and user documentation dispute flows
summary: Implement clear interfaces to show users their consolidated earnings summaries and facilitate the process for disputing data or submitting extra documentation. Promotes user trust, clarity, and process efficiency.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: earnings summaries, and options to dispute or provide additional documentation

title: Ensure compliance with local lending laws and privacy regulations
summary: Review, document, and architect all system features to maintain compliance with applicable lending, privacy, and fair lending regulations. Integrate privacy-by-design principles and embed regulatory controls across all workflows.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: compliance to local lending, privacy, and fair lending regulations

title: Secure data in transit and at rest with encryption and RBAC
summary: Implement data protection across all layers by encrypting sensitive information both in transit and at rest, and restrict system access using robust role-based access control. These controls protect user privacy and financial data, fulfilling critical fintech security requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Secure all data using encryption and role-based access

title: Provide dashboards for operations and compliance monitoring
summary: Develop interactive dashboards that allow operational teams and compliance officers to monitor key metrics, review workflow statuses, and ensure regulatory reporting obligations are met. Dashboards must support real-time visibility into system state and compliance adherence.

title: Log API activity, eligibility checks, and manual interventions for audit
summary: Configure system logging to capture API calls, eligibility rule applications, and any manual overrides or adjustments for full auditability and traceability. Comprehensive logging supports compliance and enables post-event investigation by auditors.

title: Handle unsupported platforms and incomplete data edge cases
summary: Ensure robust edge case handling for situations involving unsupported gig platforms or incomplete/missing data, including error messaging and fallback mechanisms. This minimizes application disruptions and user friction, maintaining process integrity.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: handle edge cases like missing data or unsupported currencies
